text: Mary Ellen Hinamon Withrow (born October 2, 1930) is an American public servant. She was the 40th Treasurer of the United States from March 1, 1994 to January 20, 2001 under President Bill Clinton. She also was Treasurer when the $5, $10, $20, $50, and $100 notes were redesigned in the 1990s.U.S. Treasury Biography ==References== Category:1930 births Category:Living people Category:Treasurers of the United States Category:Politicians from Ohio Category:Democratic Party (United States) politicians
title: Mary Ellen Withrow
